question: what does a yellow 35 mph sign mean
vanilla_rag_result: Based on the passages provided, a yellow sign indicating 35 mph would likely correspond to the "Yellow-over-Green" signal, which carries the meaning "Reduce to Medium speed" (35 km/h). This indicates that the train should reduce its speed to 35 km/h in preparation for the next signal, which displays one of the Medium speed indications.
